I have been training in the martial arts since the age of three.  I now work as a volunteer black belt instructor for our family run non profit school CHL. Our focus is on the Korean art of Tang Soo Do however we have incorporated pieces from both Krav Maga and Gracie Jiu Jitsu into our style as well.  We not only teach the physical side of the martial arts but also peaceful conflict resolution, how to have crucial conversations, leadership skills, relationship building, as well as much more, all through an innovative approach to the martial arts.

summary: I am an Arizona native who grew up in Paradise Valley. I attended Duke University where I studied Cultural Anthropology and Markets and Management Studies. In addition to my academic endeavors at Duke, I was elected captain of the Track and Field team and competed in the hammer throw. Saying I’m a “car guy” is a significant understatement! While I love a wide variety of exotic sports cars, I’m a Porsche enthusiast at heart. Martial arts have always been a big part of his life. I’ve been training in the Korean art of Tang Soo Do since the age of three years and continue to train and teach. I currently do business out of the Phoenix office in the Southwest Division of North Star Resource Group where I focuses my efforts on building long term meaningful relationships with professionals in the medical space as well as with a variety of business owners. Utilizing a comprehensive approach, I embrace my clients’ unique financial goals while focusing on their long term strategic plans.
